meanings.definition: To swear more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He always outswears his friends when they play video games.
meanings.sent2: She outswears her siblings whenever they argue about chores.
meanings.sent3: The parrot outswears the pirate, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for cooking outswears her interest in any other hobby.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outswears the gentle rain with its loud rumbling.

meanings.sent1: The comedian outswears all others with his colorful language on stage.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outswear when he gets frustrated with his computer.
meanings.sent3: The cat outswears the dog when it comes to expressing displeasure.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outswears her ability to control her language in public.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall outswears the babbling brook with its powerful rush.
